tn.ref: the word of Yahweh that came
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "the word that Yahweh God spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Uzziah ... Jotham ... Ahaz ... Hezekiah ... Jeroboam ... Joash
tn.text: The events in this book happened during the time of these kings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
Here "prostitution" represents the people being unfaithful to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are names of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here "house" means "family," including Jehu's descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This expression refers to kingdom of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "bow" refers to the power of the army. AT: "the military power of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This name means "no mercy." The translator may choose to represent this meaning as the name. AT: "No Mercy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This name means "no mercy." The translator may choose to represent this meaning as the name. AT: "No Mercy" See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hos:01:06|1:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This name means "not my people." The translator may choose to represent this meaning as the name. AT: "Not My People" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh is speaking to Hosea.

tn.ref: like the sand of the seashore
tn.text: This emphasizes the great number of Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: which cannot be measured or counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which no one can measure or count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: It will be that where it was said to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Where God said to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: where it was said to them
tn.text: This expression probably refers to Jezreel, the city where crimes had been committed by kings of Israel, and which was a symbol of God's punishment of them.

tn.ref: it will be said to them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will say to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will gather them together" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This expression might refer to the land where the people of Israel were in captivity (see UDB).
This refers to the time when God will put his people back in the land of Israel. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
